org.janusproject.acl

Interface ACLMessageContent

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ACLMessage.Content

    public interface ACLMessageContent
    This interface describes the Content of a given ACL Message as defined by FIPA.
    Version:
    $FullVersion$
    Author:
    $Author: madeline$, $Author: kleroy$, $Author: ptalagrand$, $Author: ngaud$
    See Also:
    FIPA ACL Message Structure Specification

      • getPerformative

        int getPerformative()
        Gets the performative of the ACL Message.

        The performative denotes the type of the communicative act of the ACL message.

        Returns:
        the performative of the ACL Message.

        Sets the performative of the ACL Message.

        The performative denotes the type of the communicative act of the ACL message.

        Parameters:

      • getSender

        org.janusproject.kernel.address.AgentAddress getSender()
        Gets the agent address of the sender of the ACL Message.

        The sender denotes the identity of the sender of the message, that is, the agent address of the agent of the communicative act.

        Returns:
        the agent address of the sender of the ACL Message.

      • getReplyTo

        java.util.Collection<org.janusproject.kernel.address.AgentAddress> getReplyTo()
        Gets the list of agent address to reply to.

        This parameter indicates that subsequent messages in this conversation thread are to be directed to the agent named in the reply-to parameter, instead of to the agent named in the sender parameter.

        Returns:
        the list of agent address to reply to.

      • setReplyTo

        This parameter indicates that subsequent messages in this conversation thread are to be directed to the agent named in the reply-to parameter, instead of to the agent named in the sender parameter.

        Parameters:

      • getContent

        java.lang.StringBuffer getContent()
        Gets the content of the ACL Message.

        The content denotes the content of the message; equivalently denotes the object of the action.

        Returns:
        the content of the ACL Message.

      • setContent

        void setContent(java.lang.StringBuffer content)
        Sets the content of the ACL Message.

        The content denotes the content of the message; equivalently denotes the object of the action.

        The meaning of the content of any ACL message is intended to be interpreted by the receiver of the message. This is particularly relevant for instance when referring to referential expressions, whose interpretation might be different for the sender and the receiver.

        Parameters:
        content - - the content of the ACL Message.

      • getLanguage

        java.lang.String getLanguage()
        Gets the language of the content of the ACL Message.

        The language denotes the language in which the content parameter is expressed.

        This field may be omitted if the agent receiving the message can be assumed to know the language of the content expression.

        Returns:
        the language of the content of the ACL Message.

      • setLanguage

        void setLanguage(java.lang.String language)
        Sets the language of the content of the ACL Message.

        The language denotes the language in which the content parameter is expressed.

        This field may be omitted if the agent receiving the message can be assumed to know the language of the content expression.

        Parameters:
        language - - the language of the content of the ACL Message.

      • getEncoding

        java.lang.String getEncoding()
        Gets the encoding of the content of the ACL Message.

        The encoding denotes the specific encoding of the content language expression.

        If the encoding parameter is not present, the encoding will be specified in the message envelope that encloses the ACL message.

        Returns:
        the encoding of the content of the ACL Message.

      • setEncoding

        void setEncoding(java.lang.String encoding)
        Sets the encoding of the content of the ACL Message.

        The encoding denotes the specific encoding of the content language expression.

        If the encoding parameter is not present, the encoding will be specified in the message envelope that encloses the ACL message.

        Parameters:
        encoding - - the encoding of the content of the ACL Message.

      • getOntology

        java.lang.String getOntology()
        Gets the ontology of the content of the ACL Message.

        The ontology denotes the ontology(s) used to give a meaning to the symbols in the content expression.

        In many situations, the ontology parameter will be commonly understood by the agent community and so this message parameter may be omitted.

        Returns:
        the ontology of the content of the ACL Message.

      • setOntology

        void setOntology(java.lang.String ontology)
        Sets the ontology of the content of the ACL Message.

        The ontology denotes the ontology(s) used to give a meaning to the symbols in the content expression.

        In many situations, the ontology parameter will be commonly understood by the agent community and so this message parameter may be omitted.

        Parameters:
        ontology - - the ontology of the content of the ACL Message.

      • getProtocol

        java.lang.String getProtocol()
        Gets the protocol used to manage the ACL Message.

        The protocol denotes the interaction protocol that the sending agent is employing with this ACL message.

        Returns:
        the protocol used to manage the ACL Message.
        See Also:
        FIPA Protocol Specification

      • setProtocol

        void setProtocol(java.lang.String protocol)
        Sets the protocol used to manage the ACL Message.

        The protocol denotes the interaction protocol that the sending agent is employing with this ACL message.

        Parameters:
        protocol - - the protocol used to manage the ACL Message.
        See Also:
        FIPA Protocol Specification

      • getConversationId

        java.util.UUID getConversationId()
        Gets the conversation Id which is associated to the ACL Message.

        The conversation Id introduces an expression (a conversation identifier) which is used to identify the ongoing sequence of communicative acts that together form a conversation.

        Returns:
        the conversation Id which is associated to the ACL Message.

      • setConversationId

        void setConversationId(java.util.UUID conversationId)
        Sets the conversation Id which is associated to the ACL Message.

        The conversation Id introduces an expression (a conversation identifier) which is used to identify the ongoing sequence of communicative acts that together form a conversation.

        Parameters:
        conversationId - - the conversation Id which is associated to the ACL Message.

      • getReplyWith

        java.lang.String getReplyWith()
        Gets the reply-with parameter of the ACL Message.

        The reply-with parameter introduces an expression that will be used by the responding agent to identify this message.

        Returns:
        the reply-with parameter of the ACL Message.

      • setReplyWith

        void setReplyWith(java.lang.String replyWith)
        Sets the reply-with parameter of the ACL Message.

        The reply-with parameter introduces an expression that will be used by the responding agent to identify this message.

        Parameters:
        replyWith - - the reply-with parameter of the ACL Message.

      • getInReplyTo

        java.lang.String getInReplyTo()
        Gets the in-reply-to parameter of the ACL Message.

        The in-reply-to parameter denotes an expression that references an earlier action to which this message is a reply.

        Returns:
        the in-reply-to parameter of the ACL Message.

      • setInReplyTo

        void setInReplyTo(java.lang.String inReplyTo)
        Sets the in-reply-to parameter of the ACL Message.

        The in-reply-to parameter denotes an expression that references an earlier action to which this message is a reply.

        Parameters:
        inReplyTo - - the in-reply-to parameter of the ACL Message.

      • getReplyBy

        java.lang.String getReplyBy()
        Gets the reply-by parameter of the ACL Message.

        The reply-by parameter denotes a time and/or date expression which indicates the latest time by which the sending agent would like to receive a reply.

        Returns:
        the reply-by parameter of the ACL Message.

      • setReplyBy

        void setReplyBy(java.lang.String replyBy)
        Sets the reply-by parameter of the ACL Message.

        The reply-by parameter denotes a time and/or date expression which indicates the latest time by which the sending agent would like to receive a reply.

        Parameters:
        replyBy - - the reply-by parameter of the ACL Message.
